algorithm_technique: Sort each row. In each step, find the maximum element across all rows and add it to the score. Repeat until matrix is empty.
problem_summary_simple: In a matrix, repeatedly remove the largest element from each row, then add the overall largest removed element to the score.
problem_summary_technical: Sort each row to easily access the largest element. Iteratively find the maximum of these row-wise maximums to accumulate the score.
key_insights: Sorting each row allows for efficient retrieval of the largest element in each row.
The problem can be solved by iterating through columns after sorting rows, as the largest elements will be at the end of sorted rows.
The greedy approach of picking the largest available element at each step guarantees the optimal solution.
